profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-05-08T16:11-0700. Supplementary encoding and revision by Caroline Cubé using Notetab Pro.

did.abstract: Cheryl Nassar was a photographer and active member of the lesbian activist community in Southern California. This collection contains photographs and ephemera from lesbian and gay pride events throughout the region.
did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. Stored off-site at SRLF. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Cheryl Nassar Papers (Collection 2229). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Provenance/Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW) and the UCLA Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Description enhanced and further physical processing completed by Jessica Tai in 2017.

The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW) and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Cheryl Nassar (July 10, 1944 - January 9, 2012) was born and grew up in Pennsylvania. She received a Bachelor's Degree in English Literature from the University of Pittsburgh. Throughout the 1980s, she was extremely active in women's rights as well as gay and lesbian rights organizations in Pittsburgh, Cincinnati, and in Southern California. She was the official photographer for many of the gay pride events throughout Southern California. She was also an avid collector of porcelain dolls.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains photographs and ephemera by Nassar documenting events such as Orange County Cultural Pride, the Orange County Pro-Choice Clinic defense rally, Long Beach Pride, San Francisco Pride, and Christopher Street West Los Angeles Pride. Also included is ephemera collected by Nassar, such as t-shirts, jewelry, and buttons.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material in this collection is organized chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: A collection of buttons, including political buttons and buttons from gay pride events. Also included are a number of handmade buttons by Nassar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Rings, necklaces and an amulet from Nassar's personal collection of jewelry.
T-shirt from the 1983 Michigan Womyn's Festival, The 1987 Women's Craft Fair, The 1989 West Coast Women's Music and Comedy Festival, and a "Keep Abortion Legal" t-shirt.

did.unittitle: Photographs: Orange County Pro-choice Clinic Defense Rally.
Photographs: South Bay Lesbian and Gay Community Organization.
Photographs: Christopher Street West Los Angeles Pride.
